instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 02020 w 12.00V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Need a clear mind on this, been spending way too much time on this board
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> on this board measures 12.00V 
I thought this has to be 12.6V on this board, right?
What can cause PPBUS to be too low? 

Strange thing is, the board boots and works fine (i only don't have trackpad connected right now, waiting on new flexes to come in tomorrow)

A little history:
Board came in with a burnt out JT400 and some liquid around <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> area.
Checked <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> and it had a low diodemode value to ground, which i traced back to a (partially) shorted <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU_ISNS_VIN</SIGNAL> in <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>.
Replaced <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> from a donor
Replaced JT400 and traces around it fixed

threads.title: 02020 w 12.00V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Is the battery charging with just 12.0V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 02020 w 12.00V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
pfff battery is at 100% right now, so no charging is going on. will have to drain the battery a bit to see if its charging, will get back here.
so far, everything seems to be working normally, just that low ppbus voltage is bothering me

threads.title: 02020 w 12.00V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
OK so it definitively charges the battery. 
Customer wants it back now, so this one is going.
The board is working, but i don't understand how PPBUS can be 12.00V without the battery...
